security_audit.summary: Documentation and guidance skill for agent development. Contains a benign validation script that checks markdown file structure. No network access, no credential theft, no data exfiltration, no malicious patterns detected.

content.value_statement: Creating effective autonomous agents requires understanding agent structure, triggering conditions, and system prompt design. This skill provides comprehensive guidance, templates, and validation tools for building production-ready Claude Code agents.
actual_capabilities: Create agent markdown files with proper YAML frontmatter structure
Design effective system prompts with clear responsibilities and process steps
Write triggering examples that enable reliable agent activation
Validate agent files using the built-in validation script
Follow best practices for tool access and least privilege
Generate agents using AI-assisted prompts and templates
limitations: Does not execute code on user systems
Does not install or deploy agents automatically
Does not provide runtime agent management
Does not connect to external services or APIs

use_cases.title: Build custom plugins
use_cases.description: Create Claude Code plugins with autonomous agents that handle specific domains like code review, testing, or documentation generation.

use_cases.title: Standardize agent patterns
use_cases.description: Establish consistent agent structures across your team with validated templates and best practice documentation.

use_cases.title: Design agent personas
use_cases.description: Design expert agent personas with clear boundaries, methodologies, and output formats for specialized tasks.

prompt_templates.title: Basic agent request
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an agent that reviews code for security issues. Use the agent development skill for guidance on structure and examples.

prompt_templates.title: Proactive agent
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a test generation agent that triggers proactively after code is written, not just when explicitly requested.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-agent system
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an orchestration agent that coordinates code review and test generation agents in sequence.

prompt_templates.title: Domain specialist
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an agent with a specific expert persona for analyzing TypeScript React performance issues. Include process steps and output format.

output_examples.input: Create an agent that generates unit tests for my code
output: Triggering: When code is written without tests or user requests test generation
System prompt includes: Test generation process, quality standards, output format, edge case handling

best_practices: Use specific triggering examples that show when the agent should activate, including context, user message, and assistant response
Follow the principle of least privilege when defining tools - restrict access to only what the agent needs
Include clear process steps, output format, and edge case handling in system prompts for reliable autonomous operation
anti_patterns: Using generic agent names like helper or assistant that do not describe specific functionality
Writing vague system prompts without concrete steps, responsibilities, or output format
Omitting triggering examples or using generic descriptions that cause unreliable agent activation

faq.question: What models can agents use?
faq.answer: Agents support inherit (recommended), sonnet, opus, and haiku. Use inherit unless specific model capabilities are needed.

faq.question: What is the maximum system prompt length?
faq.answer: System prompts should stay under 10,000 characters. Optimal length is 500-3,000 characters for most agents.

faq.question: How do agents differ from commands?
faq.answer: Agents are autonomous subprocesses for complex multi-step tasks. Commands are for user-initiated single actions.

faq.question: Is agent content stored securely?
faq.answer: Agent markdown files are stored locally in your plugin directory. No data is sent to external services.

faq.question: Why is my agent not triggering?
faq.answer: Check that description includes specific triggering examples with relevant keywords. Avoid generic language and add concrete use cases.

faq.question: Can agents use external APIs?
faq.answer: Yes, by granting the Bash or WebFetch tool. Follow least privilege and only grant necessary access for the agent's purpose.
